text: Draw a pattern. Select the fabric to be used. Often sachets can be made from scraps of fancy material left over from another project. Think through what size and shape the sachet will be. The easiest, by far, is a simple square or rectangle, but with patience and imagination, nearly any shape can be made. Add a minimum of 1/4 inch/6.3 mm seam allowance. Cut two of each shape. Sew the two pieces together with patterned or "right" sides together. Leave a two inch opening for stuffing. Miter the corners (cut them at an angle).  Turn the "right" sides out.  Add the pleasantly smelling stuffing. See below for stuffing ideas. Slip stitch the opening closed.  Place the sachet where desired and enjoy!
